case_vignette: A 41-year-old woman presents to urgent care with complaints of a new rash. On review of systems, she endorses ankle pain bilaterally. Otherwise, she has no additional localized complaints. Physical examination reveals numerous red subcutaneous nodules overlying her shins, bilaterally. Complete blood count shows leukocytes 7,300, Hct 46.2%, Hgb 18.1 g/dL, mean corpuscular volume (MCV) 88 fL, and platelets 209. Chest radiography demonstrates bilateral hilar adenopathy with clear lungs.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?
